moduleGroup.name: Cortical Thickness with SVPASEG
moduleGroup.description: This workflow takes raw brain volumes along with corresponding whole-brain masks. In order to label the tissue types, the workflow uses the SVPASEG tool. It also generates the Left and Right cortical surfaces using FreeSurfer's ReconAll tool, which is resampled to an octahedral triangulation using LONI's Octahedral Resample module. Finally, it estimates the cortical thickness at each vertex on the cortical surfaces and maps these GM-thickness values on each vertex. The results may be viewed using ShapeViewer.

moduleGroup.name: Auto Surface Extractor
moduleGroup.description: THis module uses CCB and FreeFurfer tools to automatically generate the cortical surface models from raw MRI data.

input.description: Input to force order of execution
input.name: Input Flow Control

input.description: The absolute file path to the directory in which FreeSurfer should do its work. A directory with the Subject ID as its name will be created in this directory. There, FreeSurfer will establish its necessary directory structure.
input.name: Subject Directory

input.description: Name or identification of the subject whose MR is being processed. A directory will be made with this name in the specified Subject Directory.
input.name: Subject ID

input.description: Original MR file to be processed by FreeSurfer.
input.name: Input Volume

module.name: ReconAll
module.description: Performs all steps of the ReconAll process: 1. Motion Correction and Conform 2. NU (Non-Uniform intensity normalization) 3. Talairach transform computation 4. Intensity Normalization 1 5. Skull Strip 6. EM Register (linear volumetric registration) 7. CA Intensity Normalization 8. CA Non-linear Volumetric Registration 9. Remove neck 10. EM Register, with skull 11. CA Label (Aseg: Volumetric Labeling) and Statistics 12. Intensity Normalization 2 (start here for control points) 13. White matter segmentation 14. Edit WM With ASeg 15. Fill (start here for wm edits) 16. Tessellation (begins per-hemisphere operations) 17. Smooth1 18. Inflate1 19. QSphere 20. Automatic Topology Fixer 21. Final Surfs (start here for brain edits for pial surf) 22. Smooth2 23. Inflate2 24. Cortical Ribbon Mask 25. Spherical Mapping 26. Spherical Registration 27. Spherical Registration, Contralater hemisphere 28. Map average curvature to subject 29. Cortical Parcellation (Labeling) 30. Cortical Parcellation Statistics 31. Cortical Parcellation mapped to ASeg

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: Original MR file to be processed by FreeSurfer.

input.name: Subject ID
input.description: Name or identification of the subject whose MR is being processed. A directory will be made with this name in the specified Subject Directory.

input.name: Subject Directory
input.description: The absolute file path to the directory in which FreeSurfer should do its work. A directory with the Subject ID as its name will be created in this directory. There, FreeSurfer will establish its necessary directory structure.

input.name: Input Flow Control
input.description: Input to force order of execution

input.name: Overwrite
input.description: overwrite files in output directory

module.name: OctahedralResample
module.description: This module resamples an arbitrary closed surface to have an octahedral triangulation. The input and output file formats may be any supported by the ShapeTools library.

input.name: input
input.description: This is the input shape. This must be closed and in a format supported by the ShapeTools library.

input.name: resolution
input.description: This specifies the image resolution used when resampling. Larger values allow the algorithm to capture more anatomic detail. A reasonable choice is the resolution of the image from which the original surface was constructred.

input.name: overwrite
input.description: Enables output overwriting

input.name: verbose
input.description: Enables verbose reporting

input.name: executable
input.description: The path to the python executable

input.name: fix topology
input.description: Fix the surface topology. This will ensure that the surface will be spherical, but some fine detail may be lost in the process

input.name: simplify
input.description: Simplify the surface before resampling

author.fullName: Boris Gutman, Ilya Eckstein, Ryan Cabeen

module.name: Cortical Thickness
module.description: This module computes the cortical thickness of a CSF/GM/WM segmented image and returns the thickness measurements at the vertices of a mesh provided by the user. This is implemented using AIR's distance_quick and gsmooth and ShapeTools' ShapeTransform, ShapeAttribute and ImageToShapeAttribute.

input.name: version
input.description: show program's version number and exit

input.name: help
input.description: show this help message and exit

input.name: verbose
input.description: print status messages to standard output

input.name: debug
input.description: print debugger messages

input.name: java path
input.description: specify a custom java vm executable path

input.name: project path
input.description: specify a custom project path

input.name: maximum thickness
input.description: specify the maximum thickness in distance_quick

input.name: fwhm
input.description: specify the FWHM of the kernel for gsmooth in spatial units (mm, usually)

input.name: mask
input.description: specify that gsmooth should not use the segmentation to mask the smoothing

input.name: csf label
input.description: specify the csf segmentation label

input.name: gray matter label
input.description: specify the gray matter segmentation label

input.name: white matter label
input.description: specify the white matter segmentation label

input.name: vertex attribute id
input.description: specify the string id to use for the vertex attribute for shape output mode

input.name: input image
input.description: the CSF, GM, WM segmented image in either MINC or ANALYZE formats

input.name: input mesh
input.description: the mesh whose vertices will be used to extract the cortical thickness. This may be in any format supported by the ShapeTools library. The coordinate system of the vertices should match the image.

output.name: output
output.description: The output cortical thickness. The format of this will depend on the output mode argument.

input.name: minimum thickness
input.description: specify the minimum thickness. This should be positive to avoid issues where the mesh vertices are not exactly inside the gray matter mask

input.name: scale
input.description: specify the scale used to multiply labels to follow file format conversion of data

input.name: save dir
input.description: specify a temporary directory where intermediate results will be saved. When not set, a system-appropriate temporary directory will be created and removed upon exiting

input.name: double
input.description: specify that thickness values should be doubled. This option is available to be consistent with previous methods.

input.name: output mode
input.description: specify the output file format. This can be a plain-text list of values for each vertex (txt), an OpenDX shape with the original coordinates and the thickness values stored as an attribute (dx) or a attempt to use the original coordinates and the thickness values as an attribute in the same format as the input (same). Default: txt

input.name: overwrite
input.description: -o, --overwrite overwrite existing files

module.name: MRI Convert
module.description: mri_convert is a general purpose utility for converting between different file formats. mri_convert will try to figure out the file format on its own from the format of the file name (eg, files that end in .img are assumed to be in spm analyze format).

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: The name of the input volume.

filetype.name: GDF file
filetype.description: GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use gis)

filetype.name: NIFTI1 file
filetype.description: NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files)

filetype.name: SPM file
filetype.description: SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d)

input.name: Drop Frames
input.description: Drop the last <n> frames.

input.name: TE
input.description: TE in msec. Must specify <te>.

input.name: Output Info
input.description: Displays information about the output volume.

input.name: Crop
input.description: <x> <y> <z> Crop to 256 around center (x,y,z).

input.name: Output j Size
input.description: Specifies the output <j size>.

input.name: Zero GE z Offset
input.description: Sets c_s=0 (appropriate for DICOM files from GE machines with isocenter scanning).

input.name: Output Orientation Setting
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (ostring). The ostring is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 1)
input.description: Specifies option <sonata | allegra | GE> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 2-5 as well.

input.name: Output i Direction
input.description: Specifies the output i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Output k Count
input.description: Specifies the output <k count>.

input.name: Resample Type
input.description: Specifies resample type. Must specify <interpolate|weighted|nearest|sinc|cubic>. (Default=interpolate)

input.name: TI
input.description: TI in msec (note uppercase flag). Must specify <ti>.

input.name: Force RAS Good
input.description: Uses default when orientation is absent.

input.name: Input Orientation Settings
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (<ostring>). The <ostring> is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Input Info
input.description: To display information about input volume.

input.name: Apply Inverse Transform
input.description: This option applies the specified transformation file (xfm) inversely.

input.name: Output j Direction
input.description: Specifies the output j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the input volume.

input.name: Input i Direction
input.description: Specifies the input i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Flip Angle
input.description: Flip Angle in radians. Must specify <flip_angle>.

input.name: Output j Count
input.description: Specifies the output <j count>.

input.name: Output k Size
input.description: Specifies the output <k size>.

input.name: Skip Frames
input.description: Skip the first <n> frames.

input.name: No Scale Flag
input.description: Doesn't allow changing type of input to that of template. Must specify <n>. 1 = Don't rescale values for COR.

input.name: Output Data Type
input.description: Specifies the output data type. Must specify <uchar|short|int|float>.

input.name: Input i Size
input.description: Specifies the input <i size>.

input.name: Output Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the output volume.

input.name: Input k Size
input.description: Specifies the input <k size>.

input.name: Output k Direction
input.description: Specifies the output k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input j Direction
input.description: Specifies the input j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: FWHM
input.description:
<fwhm>
Smooth input volume by <fwhm> mm.

input.name: Crop Size
input.description: <dx> <dy> <dz> Crop to size <dx, dy, dz>.

input.name: Output Center
input.description: Specifies the output center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

input.name: Input j Size
input.description: Specifies the input <j size>.

input.name: Output Matrix
input.description: Displays output matrix.

input.name: Input Center
input.description: Specifies the input center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

output.name: Output Volume
output.description: The name of the output volume.

input.name: Input k Direction
input.description: Specifies the input k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Matrix
input.description: Displays input matrix.

input.name: Output i Count
input.description: Specifies the output <i count>.

input.name: Apply Transform
input.description: This option applies the transformation (xfm) file to the input volume.

input.name: Output i Size
input.description: Specifies the output <i size>.

input.name: Like Volume
input.description: Output is embedded in a volume like specified volume.

input.name: TR
input.description: TR in msec. Must specify <tr>.

input.name: Input Scale Factor
input.description:
<factor>
Input intensity scale factor.

input.name: Conform Size
input.description:
<size_in_mm>
Conform to the src min direction size.

input.name: Input Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Template Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Template Info
input.description: Dump info about template.

input.name: Status File (DICOM Convert)
input.description: Outputs status file for DICOM conversion.

input.name: Parse Only
input.description: Parse only.

input.name: Reorder Axes
input.description:
<olddim1> <olddim2> <olddim3>
Reorders axes such that: olddim1 is the new column dimension olddim2 is the new row dimension olddim3 is the new slice dimension.
Example: 2 1 3 will swap rows and cols.

input.name: List (DICOM Conversion)
input.description: Lists DICOM files for conversion.

input.name: GDF Image File
input.description: <gdf image file stem>

input.name: Invert Contrast
input.description:
<threshold>
All voxels in volume greater than specified threshold are replaced with 255-value. Only makes sense for 8 bit images. Only operates on the first frame.

input.name: Conform
input.description: Conform to 1mm voxel size in coronal slice direction with 256^3 or more.

input.name: No Write
input.description: Does not write to specified output.

input.name: Output Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:

CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT

For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Input n SPM Zero Pad
input.description:
<N>
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Input Volume?
input.description: Specifies input volume.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 2)
input.description: Specify option <fullUnwarp | through-plane> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1, 3-5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 3)
input.description: Specifies option <JacobianCorrection | noJacobianCorrection> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-2, 4-5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 4)
input.description: Specifies option <linear | sinc> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-3 and 5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 5)
input.description: Specifies <sincInterpHW> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-4 as well.

module.name: Gamixture
module.description: Used for fitting the Finite Mixture Model to the image data using the genetic algorithms.
module.tag: FMM Finite Mixture Model Genetic algorithm

input.name: Input image file
input.description: Enter the MRI T1 image that is to be segmented.

input.name: Maskfile
input.description: Enter the Maskfile of the brain without the skull. This will be used to perform skull stripping. All voxels with the value greater than 0.5 (in the mask) are assumed to belong to the brain.

input.name: Atlasfile
input.description: This is the atlas specification file.

output.name: Output fmmparamfile
output.description: A file where the mixture parameters are written.

input.name: Unsigned
input.description: Specifying this option will assume that the data is unsigned.

input.name: Alpha
input.description: Parameter for blended crossover, defaults to 0.5.

input.name: Size
input.description: Population size, defaults to 100

input.name: Terminationthr
input.description: Threshold for terminating the algorithm, defaults to 0.0005

input.name: xoverrate
input.description: Crossover rate, defaults to 1

input.name: Maxgenerations
input.description: Maximum number of generations, defaults to 500

input.name: Sortpop
input.description: Whether to use the permutation operator, defaults to 1

input.name: Parzenn
input.description: Number of points for Parzen estimate (for approximate ML), defaults to 101

input.name: Parzensigma
input.description: Window width parameter for the Parzen estimate, defaults to 1.

input.name: Equalvar
input.description: Whether component densities should have equal variances, defaults to 0

input.name: Restarts
input.description: The number of individual runs of the GA, defaults to 10

module.name: SVPASEG
module.description: Brain tissue classification based on local Markov random fields and ICM algorithm..

input.name: Input image file
input.description: Enter the MRI T1 image that is to be segmented.

input.name: Maskfile
input.description: Enter the Maskfile of the brain without the skull. This will be used to perform skull stripping. All voxels with the value greater than 0.5 (in the mask) are assumed to belong to the brain.

input.name: Atlasfile
input.description: This is the atlas specification file.

input.name: fmmparamfile
input.description: A mixture parameters file. Misture parameter file must match the atlas specification file.

input.name: Unsigned
input.description: Specifying this option will assume that the data is unsigned.

input.name: Beta1
input.description: Regularization parameter first first-order interactions, defaults depend on particular model setting. It is NOT recommended to change the defaults.

input.name: Beta2
input.description: Regularization parameter for second order interactions i.e. controls the strenght of the spatial regularization component. Defaults to 0.05

input.name: PVElabels
input.description: Controls whether intermediate PVE classification labels are written, not relevant except for p-type atlases.

output.name: Labelfile
output.description: This is the tissue classified image (only pure tissue types).

module.name: Cortical Thickness
module.description: This module computes the cortical thickness of a CSF/GM/WM segmented image and returns the thickness measurements at the vertices of a mesh provided by the user. This is implemented using AIR's distance_quick and gsmooth and ShapeTools' ShapeTransform, ShapeAttribute and ImageToShapeAttribute.

input.name: version
input.description: show program's version number and exit

input.name: help
input.description: show this help message and exit

input.name: verbose
input.description: print status messages to standard output

input.name: debug
input.description: print debugger messages

input.name: java path
input.description: specify a custom java vm executable path

input.name: project path
input.description: specify a custom project path

input.name: maximum thickness
input.description: specify the maximum thickness in distance_quick

input.name: fwhm
input.description: specify the FWHM of the kernel for gsmooth in spatial units (mm, usually)

input.name: mask
input.description: specify that gsmooth should not use the segmentation to mask the smoothing

input.name: csf label
input.description: specify the csf segmentation label

input.name: gray matter label
input.description: specify the gray matter segmentation label

input.name: white matter label
input.description: specify the white matter segmentation label

input.name: vertex attribute id
input.description: specify the string id to use for the vertex attribute for shape output mode

input.name: input image
input.description: the CSF, GM, WM segmented image in either MINC or ANALYZE formats

input.name: input mesh
input.description: the mesh whose vertices will be used to extract the cortical thickness. This may be in any format supported by the ShapeTools library. The coordinate system of the vertices should match the image.

output.name: output
output.description: The output cortical thickness. The format of this will depend on the output mode argument.

input.name: minimum thickness
input.description: specify the minimum thickness. This should be positive to avoid issues where the mesh vertices are not exactly inside the gray matter mask

input.name: scale
input.description: specify the scale used to multiply labels to follow file format conversion of data

input.name: save dir
input.description: specify a temporary directory where intermediate results will be saved. When not set, a system-appropriate temporary directory will be created and removed upon exiting

input.name: double
input.description: specify that thickness values should be doubled. This option is available to be consistent with previous methods.

input.name: output mode
input.description: specify the output file format. This can be a plain-text list of values for each vertex (txt), an OpenDX shape with the original coordinates and the thickness values stored as an attribute (dx) or a attempt to use the original coordinates and the thickness values as an attribute in the same format as the input (same). Default: txt

input.name: overwrite
input.description: -o, --overwrite overwrite existing files
